definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
unspoken dialogue in a play, left for the audience to infer/subtext/(fig.) implicit assertion

sentences.english: which is a line from one of Shakespeare plays.
sentences.chinese: 這是莎士比亞戲劇裏的一句臺詞。

sentences.english: The actor is learning his lines from memory.
She will run over her lines in the evening.
sentences.chinese: 她將在晚上排練一次她的臺詞。

sentences.english: The lines are different, depending on how each and everyone improvises .
sentences.chinese: 臺詞不盡相同，如何演繹，則在於個人即興創作。

sentences.english: She walked on stage again, shaking from head to foot, and started speaking.
sentences.chinese: 她再次走上臺，渾身上下抖個不停，開始說臺詞。

sentences.english: With opening night only a week away, I was still learning my lines. (learn my lines?)
sentences.chinese: 離首映只有一週了，我還在背臺詞。

sentences.english: As an actor, do you get to suggest bits of dialogue or do some improv?
sentences.chinese: 作爲演員，你會主動商榷臺詞或做些即興表演嗎？

sentences.english: Create a scene or an event that sets the groundwork for subtextual meaning.
sentences.chinese: 創造一個場景或事件爲潛臺詞打好基礎。

sentences.english: I've been memorizing scripts, regularly since I was about 14 years old.
sentences.chinese: 我從14歲起就開始每隔一段時間就會背誦臺詞。

sentences.english: The actress forgot her lines and had to extemporize .
sentences.chinese: 那個女演員忘了臺詞，只好即興表演。

sentences.english: The subtext of her book is that sexual self-revelation is groundbreaking in itself.
sentences.chinese: 作品的潛臺詞是性流露是一種自我突破。

sentences.english: He threw away the last line.
sentences.chinese: 他把最後一句臺詞輕聲帶過。

sentences.english: She learned her lines in a few hours.
sentences.chinese: 她幾個小時就背熟了臺詞。

sentences.english: Say Ur lines, but do U feel them ?
sentences.chinese: 念著你的臺詞，但你是否感同身受？

sentences.english: The actor was nervous and dried up in the middle of his speech.
sentences.chinese: 那個演員很緊張，演到一半時突然忘了臺詞。

definition: dialogue (in a movie or a play)
from start to finish/from head to tail/the whole (thing)
Zen saying repeated as cant/(fig.) catchphrase/mantra/favorite expression/stock phrase
scene (in a movie etc)/one's part in a movie or play/(archaic) actor's payment
Wong Kar-wai (1956-), Hong Kong film director
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
